Reviews.Content: Great Location Stayed in the Hotel Duomo for three nights from September 6th. Great location. Our room had a balcony on the top floor overlooking the Duomo. The room had a refrigerator and a safe. The bathroom was clean and there were lots of towels. The receptionists were helpful and the breakfast was adequate. To access the hotel you go into a small courtyard and take the elevator on the left to the 4th floor. It is less than a ten minute walk from the train station and even less from the market.We would definately recommend this hotel and hope to visit it again soon.
Reviews.Author: RoisinNewYork

Reviews.Content: great site wonderful friendly , helpfull staff .very clean room . bed linen changed 3 times during our 8 night stay.Plenty of fresh clean towels every day.Would certainly go back. Great place to stay for sightseeing , very central.
Reviews.Author: HAPPY6377

Reviews.Content: Amazing!       Room 24 view
Reviews.Author: rachelsstudio_com

Reviews.Content: Excellent Base Small hotel with superb view of the Duomo - close to all the major attractions in Florence.Very good facilities in a clean and very friendly environment.Would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a base to explore the city.
Reviews.Author: England133

Reviews.Content: great base for sight-seeing       hotel facade - left on 4th floor - on piazza
Reviews.Author: lilfella

Reviews.Content: Great Stay Cant Complain ,,, Great room, Amazing View , Staff Very Helpful . Would stay there again !!

Truly Wonderful!!! I travelled to Florence alone as a friend is living there at the moment. I wanted to stay somewhere that was very central and close to my friends apartment. This def met both of these requirements.You cant ask to be more central the duomo is directly opposite and from the breakfast room the view from the balcony is truly amazing. Other sites such as the square with the replica of the statue of david  sante croce are only a short walk away and the main shopping street is very close, as is the leather market. The train and coach station are within easy reach with regular trains to piza, milan, sienna, bologne and even rome.As for the hotel this was lovely. It is on the 4th floor however theres a lift if you dont want to walk up the stairs. The fact the hotel is on the 4th floor makes the views so much better. The staff are really lovely, they are friendly, helpful and very good at speaking english. The continental breakfast was lovely and the breakfast room was kept clean and tidy.The room was lovely, very clean and modern it even had a flat screen tv. It was cleaned each day and towels changed regularly.I intend to travel to florence again very soon, and would def book into the hotel duomo again.
Reviews.Author: ejb_2007Yorkshire

Reviews.Content: Great hotel - Fabulous location This hotel was great - I'm not one of those people that needs the Ritz - I look for good location, good value, breakfast, cleanliness, and hospitality. This hotel had all of those things! The location is fabulous! Literally right next to the Duomo. It's an easy walking distance to everything worth seeing, and surrounded by lots of little markets and leather shops. The room was great - the beds are a little hard, but were fine after getting used to them. The bathroom was fairly large and very clean - truly, the hotel is everything you need and want for a European vacation - everything worked, not too small, very clean, great location, great staff, good breakfast - can't recommend it enough. You should, however, DEFINITELY eat at Acqua Al 2 restaurant - it was delicious - we ate there 2 nights in a row. Walking distance from the hotel.
Reviews.Author: iahwki

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel       Taken from my hotel room window
Reviews.Author: Jaymz28

Reviews.Content: Great location! We stayed 4 nights at Hotel Duomo and we enjoyed the stay very much!The room (38) was clean and quiet,the bathroom was extremly clean and modern (with bathtube),the breakfast was good (even the croissants were good,which is very rare in Italy!).The strong point of this hotel is his location:in the heart of the city,near the train and bus station (10mn by walk!).So,enjoy your stay!
Reviews.Author: MimiGeneva

Reviews.Content: loved duomo hotel
Reviews.Author: mania.t

Reviews.Content: The Duomo was a GREAT Hotel to stay at in Florence The Hotel Duomo was perfect. Clean rooms, very helpful staff, EXCELLENT location, right in the heart of the city. It was very well priced. The Duomo was right outside our window, the bells were our wakeup call each morning. I highly recommend this hotel when you stay in Florence.
Reviews.Author: rbwriter

Reviews.Content: Excellent Location, Service,  Hotel room was lovely, VERY clean,  incredible view! We had a triple room that was quite spacious. Staff was very friendly,  spoke fluent English. They were helpful in making restaurant choices  right on target. If driving, it is tricky to get there, but once you get it... no problem  they have a garage that they will park it for you for $21E/day. I would definitely stay there again!
Reviews.Author: 34Italy

Reviews.Content: Really nice! Of the three hotels we stayed at in Italy, this one was the best. It was recently remodeled and is very slick looking. When we opened our windows we were staring at the marble facade of the Duomo, right across the way. The staff was also the best. Very helpful with all kinds of recommendations for sites, restaurants, etc. Very friendly. Despite the proximity to all of the Firenze action, our windows kept out all of the noise. The bathrooms were also very nice. The only Italian hotel that had real towels and not the waffle weave stiff numbers we had everywhere else. At 160 euros per night it was the priciest of our trip, but still a good value. This is a great place to stay in Florence.JD
Reviews.Author: SactoJD

Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel This hotel is a true gem. It is conveniently located, clean, and charming. The people that run the hotel are lovely.
Reviews.Author: elenakennedy

Reviews.Content: Great value and location Just returned from a weekend in Florence at the Hotel Duomo. This hotel is an excellent value for a 3-star hotel in Florence. It was much cheaper than any other 3-star property I could find, especially considering the location right next to the Duomo. You couldn't get any more central. Also, the hotel is on the high end of 3-star hotels, even for North American standards. The room had probably recently been redone with lovely wood floors and comfy paneling above the bed. The minibar was super cheap. Only things I would say keeping it from 4-star are the quality of the bed and sheets (a little hard) and the shower (very small and every 30 seconds water slows to a trickle). Everything was spotlessly clean and the receptionists very helpful. Breakfast was plenty good enough for being included - croissants, cereal, yogurt, etc. Overall, a great value and would definitely recommend.
Reviews.Author: scottsdalearizona

Reviews.Content: Not a surprise We just came back a couple of days ago. We were there the week of July 13th. I am glad that we read the reviews on this hotel first. The hotel was very clean, but there was a lot of noise outside because it is located across from the Duomo. There were a lot of sirens from ambulances through out the night. Most of the concierges were very helpful, but one woman was particularly condescending when I asked her more about Tuscany. She rudely replied you are in Tuscany. I just wanted to know about tours from her. If I were to go back to Florence I would stay somewhere a little quieter.
Reviews.Author: pamelaross

Reviews.Content: Wonderful place Hotel was easy to find, right by the church, and had big letters at the top of the building saying HOTEL DUOMO. The lift up to the hotel is small, but works great. As soon as I got off the lift, the manager was very friendly and welcoming at the desk. Very informative and spoke great English. Showed me to my room and pointed out all the amenities. I stayed in a single room. It was pretty small, but very comfortable and very nicely laid out/decorated. Refrigerator in the room, safety lock-box in the room, very nice bathroom (especially for an Italian hotel!!!), air conditioning, and a small balcony with a breathtaking view of the church and dome. The church was under construction when I went, a little unfortunate, but still a very admirable view. The staff helped me plan out my few days in Florence by giving me a map and pointing out areas of interest. I will most definitely stay here again, and hopefully soon!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very Nice...       View from room.
Reviews.Author: bilbao58

Reviews.Content: Perfect!!! Highly recommend The hotel was recently redone, so everything is brand new and beautiful. The staff (especially the lady who works the desk in the days) goes beyond being helpful. They printed out train timetables for us and advised about restaurants. They answered every request! I can't say enough about the location! It is located in the heart of the historic center of Florence, all of the major sites are within a short stroll. I can't think of a bad thing to say about the Hotel Duomo. I would recommend it to everyone.
Reviews.Author: HobokenGirl

Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Duomo! We stayed at the Duomo for 3 nights in May 2006 and had a fully enjoyable stay. An excellent location, literally on the doorstep of all main attractions and within a stones throw of an array of Bars and eateries.The hotel was spotlessly clean and decorated to a high standard with extremely helpful and friendly staff. Our Double room was a generous size and well decorated with a spacious en-suite. Our balcony had views onto the Duomo itself which was an excellent view to wake up to. There is no dining facilities and the breakfast is fresh but basic but overall for a three star hotel this one certainly exceeds expectations!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Sent my parents there! We actually visited this hotel a few years ago, and liked it a lot. We recommended it to my parents for their trip this year, and they gave us a good report too. It has a very good location, slap up against the Duomo, so you can walk anywhere and come back to refresh during the day if you get too hot. It is clean and well-furnished. It is not pretentious, but it is welcoming and the rooms are comfortable. The hotel is not at street level, but there is a lift.
Reviews.Author: riverwater

Reviews.Content: What a view! Situated right next to the Duomo and conveniently located to other Florence must sees, this hotel is ideal particularly if this is your first stay in Florence. The rooms are clean and tidy (although the open plan shower required a bit of negotiating) and air conditioning worked well. The staff are multilingual and enormously helpful and the continental breakfast was very pleasing.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fabulous stay!!! What a fantastic location with great views from our rooms...I traveled with 8 of my family members...the desk workers were beyond helpful and we truly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Duomo!! Would love to return someday!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Location! Wife and I just got back from our honeymoon and stayed at the Hotel Duomo.Overall, we enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again.One thing to note was how close to the Duomo it was. Its right across the street. This presents both good and bad things. One, the view was AMAZING- you walk onto the balcony and look out and up to the Duomo. The downside to that is that this particular Piazza, the kids like to hang out there at night till at least 1:30am. Even with the hotel on the 4th floor, it still created alot of noise- the kids, the cars, and sirens. Therefore, we couldnt leave the door open at night for the view nor for the cool night weather.Another thing to note: the room was very roomy for European standards, two twin beds together to make a queen size. BUT, the bathroom did not have a built in shower- it was one of those create a shower in the bathroom via shower curtain. This wasnt bad but strange for such a large bedroom to have a very tiny bathroom.The hotel service was great. The hotel made reservations for us to one of the major museums and recommended how to handle getting into the Uffizi Gallery (the reservations was booked till a month in advance and we waited an hour to get in).The location was excellent. The Duomo is pretty much right in the center of Florence near the river. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great view of the Duomo Very convenient with a great view of Duomo. Closer than you can imagine, just the opposite of the room.Rooms are nice and spacious.I will definitely recommend friends to stay here or even come back by myself for the next visit. Supavadee, Bangkok Thailand
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Duomo - a real treat What a great hotel. Excellent location, great staff, and overall, a really nice place to stay. This quickly became the gem of our holiday and we'll go back there for sure.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I'm ready to go back! The Hotel Duomo was very nice. I felt right at home. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is right in the middle of Florence. Everything is within a short walking distance. Bring good walking shoes. I looked out my window and you stare at the Duomo. When I go back to Florence, this is where I would stay again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pretty in Pastels I stayed in the Hotel Duomo in August 2001. he location of this hotel is amazing - right next to the multi-coloured pastel Duomo - so close that you felt you could reach out of your window and touch it. it is slap bang in the centre of the city, between the Ponte Vecchio and the statue of David. It is also fairly close to the train station which is great if you are back-packing. Excellent value for money as it is a touch of luxury with well appointed rooms. The staff are really friendly and couldn't be more helpful. Only down-side is that it is up a few flights of stairs, there is a small lift, so avoid if you have mountains of luggage.Apart from that it is a great place to stay, so have fun!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
